list_definition.definition: a set of regularly spaced marks made on something (eg a thermometer or a ruler) for use as a measure; a system of numbers, measurement etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: This thermometer has two scales marked on it, one in Fahrenheit and one in Centigrade.

list_definition.definition: a series or system of items of increasing or decreasing size, value etc

list_definition.mean_english: sự sắp xếp theo trình tự
list_definition.definition: in music, a group of notes going up or down in order

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The boy practised his scales on the piano.

list_definition.definition: the size of measurements on a map etc compared with the real size of the country etc shown by it

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: In a map drawn to the scale 1:50,000, one centimetre represents half a kilometre.
These guns are being manufactured on a large scale.
The prisoner scaled the prison walls and escaped.

list_definition.definition: any of the small thin plates or flakes that cover the skin of fishes, reptiles etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: A herring’s scales are silver in colour.
